page.title: 13FARMING IN DAVIOT TODAY.
page.content: The principal breed of cattle in Strathnairn is cross simmental and Aberdeen angus. There are very few highland cattle nowadays.This is because they only breed every 2 years and do not fatten up as well as other breeds. Most of the Daviot cattle are for beef production. {SHEEP.}All the farms have black-face sheep and some also have border leicesters and cheviots.Cross bred lambs are also very common. {CROPS.}Most farms grow as much winter feeding for the animals as they can. This is usually hay and turnips.The land is not flat enough for arable farming.Some potatoes are grown. {HILL LAND.}Much hill land has been bought by the forestry for planting with trees.
